thread.title: Country View scramble tourney puts bow on season
thread.title_full: Country View scramble tourney puts bow on season

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Country View scramble tourney puts bow on season
text:
Country View scramble tourney puts bow on season By Staff | Oct 13, 2015 
Brooks â€” Country View Golf Course closed shop on the season on Saturday, Oct. 10 as the club held its scramble tournament. 
The 18-hole scramble was played in chilly conditions and wealth of wind, but the 14 squads had solid rounds to wrap the year. The tourney, a fundraiser to make course updates, collected $4,200. 
The foursome of Doug Merrifield, Gary Snowden, John Cushman and Keith Todd won the tourney. 
Dave Thompson of Waldo was closest to the pin for the men and Theresa Hainer of Bangor closest for the women, while Dan Keene of Belfast won the men's longest drive and Donna Bean of Holden the longest drive among women. 
The tourney ended with the golfers partaking in chili, corn bread and carrot cake, while prizes and trophies were awarded to the winners. 
Representatives of the course thanked their donors, including Country View Golf Course, sculptor Forest Hart, Gibbs Family Hardware, J.P. Wentworth, Marsh River Co-op, Morrill General Store, Norma's Country Style, Ralph's Cafe, Swan Lake Grocery, Tom Gordon and Quimby's Kitchen. 
They also thanked club founders, members, players and fans for a fantastic season and look forward to more exciting and larger events in 2016.
